title: [$250] Report name in preview doesn't update

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem The report name displayed in the Expense Report preview does not update when the policy name is updated and the custom report name formula references the policy name. Furthermore, I have verified that the front end receives the Onyx updates for the report name, and the new name is saved into IndexedDB, but the UI does not update. ## Test steps 1. Run the pre-testing steps from the [manual testing document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q6T1rOSgGu6H29a5TdnW5obvvkAiGE5QeDtlayWNxw8/edit?usp=sharing) 2. Run the test case [Policy level formula {report:policyName}](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q6T1rOSgGu6H29a5TdnW5obvvkAiGE5QeDtlayWNxw8/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.mkwknz8vj8rn) ## Actual result After updating the policy/workspace name the expense report preview does not show the updated report name ## Expected result It shows the updated report name without having to open the report # Solution Investigate the root cause, likely something causing the data to not update directly when the value from Onyx changes

Open a reported expense on NewDot 2. Attempt to update the amount to $0 → it is not allowed 3. Switch to OldDot and update the same expense amount to $0 → update is successful 4. Return to NewDot and view the expense → it still shows the original amount, not $0 ## Expected Result: Both NewDot and OldDot should allow updating a cash or personal card expense transaction to $0 consistently when editing an expense amount is allowed. ## Actual Result: NewDot disallows updating to $0. An error message is displayed as `Please enter a valid amount before continuing`, yet OldDot allows it. Further, after updating an amount to $0 in OldDot, NewDot shows the original amount incorrectly. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Tighten the onyx export masking logic

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
From [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1755699468779659) ### Background Currently some fields are left behind in state masking which is a security vulnerability. We need to make sure that no private information is shared when exporting one's Onyx state through Troubleshoot. ### Problem When users export their Onyx state through the Troubleshoot feature, sensitive personal data remains visible in the exported text files, which creates a security vulnerability that could lead to unauthorized account access. ### Solution Expand the masking rules so that no private information is shared when exporting one’s Onyx state through Troubleshoot. You can find the list of keys in attached file. This is not sensitive information per se, but its not needed for the purpose of exporting the onyx state so we can mask it
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @hungvu193

title: [$250] Optimize `style` prop usage by using StyleSheet.create

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
cc: @mountiny ## Background In our project we have two ways of passing styles to components: 1. Using global styles defined in styles.ts 2. Inline styling (eg. `style={{width: 100}}`) The following approach is fine according to the [React Native documentation](https://reactnative.dev/docs/style). However, the implementation of `StyleSheet.create` on React Native and `react-native-web` differs. On React Native it basically does nothing and [returns the same JS object](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/main/packages/react-native/Libraries/StyleSheet/StyleSheetExports.js#L191-L202) it receives as argument. That’s why the docs say it’s fine to use plain JS objects. But on react-native-web it triggers [CSS class compilation logic](https://github.com/necolas/react-native-web/blob/master/packages/react-native-web/src/exports/StyleSheet/index.js#L79-L97). Because of that some CSS props may not work as expected. One of the problematic props is `pointerEvents`, which is handled a bit differently while not passed via `StyleSheet.create`. Another thing is that passing plain JS objects or inline styling on web is not very performant, thus we should use `StyleSheet.create` instead. This makes sure that `react-native-web` creates CSS classes that are attached to components. ## Performance impact The following measurements have been made on an example app, in order to focus only on the `style` performance. ### Using StyleSheet.create reduces the render time by ~10% on web What’s important to indicate, in the example app I didn’t have any complex logic, without any major computation, which means it’s almost pure component render. Potential further improvements not to be prioritized now #### Removing array passed to style can save ~3% of the render time Also pretty interesting metric, but not so spectacular, even though on Android the difference could reach to 7%. However, because it would require some major refactor I think we could leave it for now. Especially because we don’t use an array in every place where style prop gets passed. This means that its impact can be smaller, and I would like to do some bigger measurements in App before committing.

  • Upwork Job ID: 1965063735657791708
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-09-08
